00013 /// Used as a temp storage for processing messages, holds the key of a key value pair
00014 char xPLMsgKey[xPLMSGKEYLENGTH];
00015 /// Used as a temp storage for processing messages, holds the value of a key value pair
00016 char xPLMsgValue[xPLMSGVALUELENGTH];
00017 
00018 /// xPL device name, vendor ID
00019 static rom char xPL_My_Vendor_ID[] = {"oden"};
00020 /// xPL device name, device ID
00021 static rom char xPL_My_Device_ID[] = {"pir"};
00022 /// xPL device name, instance ID
00023 rom char Default_xPL_My_Instance_ID[] = {"thefirst"};
00024 
00025 /// xPL Message Types
00026 static ROM char *xPLmessageTypeText[] =
00027 {
00028         "xpl-cmnd",     // command
00029         "xpl-stat",     // trigger
00030         "xpl-trig"      // status
00031 };
00032 
00033 /// xPL Header contents, this data is mandatory for the message to be valid
00034 static ROM char *xPLHeaderKeyText[] =
00035 {
00036         "hop",          // number of hops the message has made
00037         "source",       // xpl device that generated the message
00038         "target",       // xpl device the message is intended for
00039         "}"                     // used to determine that the header is over
00040 };
00041 
00042 /// xPL Schema's (class) that are supported by this application. hbeat and config are mandatory for any xPL device, add functionality after these entries.
00043 /// If adding value dont forget to add XPL_SCHEMACLASS_SIZE
00044 static ROM char *xPLschemaClassText[] =
00045 {
00046         "hbeat",                // heart beat, part of base protocol
00047         "config",               // config, part of base
00048         "security"              // security
00049 };
00050 
00051 /// xPL Schema's (type) that are supported by this application. The first 6 are mandatory for any xPL device, add functionality after these entries.
00052 static ROM char *xPLschemaTypeText[] =
00053 {
00054         "basic",                // part of base protocol
00055         "list",                 // part of base protocol
00056         "end",                  // part of base protocol
00057         "response",             // part of base protocol
00058         "request",              // part of base protocol
00059         "current",              // part of base protocol
00060         "area",         // security starts here
00061         "zone",
00062         "gateway",
00063         "areastat",
00064         "zonestat",
00065         "gatestat",
00066         "areainfo",
00067         "zoneinfo",
00068         "gateinfo",
00069         "arealist",
00070         "zonelist"
00071 };
00072 
00073 /// True if the device has received all needed configuration details from the hub.
00074 BOOL xPLConfiguerd;
00075 
00076 /// Time since last Heartbeat was sent
00077 TICK xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount;
00078 /// Time spent in not configured state
00079 TICK xPLNotConfiguredTimer;
00080 /// Declares the Microchip IP socket that will be used for processing xPL messages
00081 UDP_SOCKET XPLSocket = INVALID_UDP_SOCKET;
00082 // Defines a received xPL message
00083 xPLReceivedMessages xPLReceivedMessage;

00104 //******************************************************************************
00105 /**
00106 Initiates the xPL stack. This must be called before XPLTasks() or things will go wrong
00107 @result Returns true if a socket was selected.
00108 */
00109 BOOL xPLInit(void) {
00110 
00111 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00112         putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPLInit called\r\n");
00113 #endif
00114 
00115         // Load the schema init
00116         xPLConfiguerd = SchemaInit();
00117 
00118         // set default values when not configured
00119         if(!xPLConfiguerd) {
00120                 xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval = XPL_NOTCONFIGUREDHBINTERVAL;
00121                 xPLNotConfiguredTimer = TickGet() + (XPL_NOTCONFIGUREDTIMEOUT * TICK_SECOND);
00122                 memset(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID,'\0', 17);
00123                 strcpypgm2ram(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID, Default_xPL_My_Instance_ID);
00124 
00125 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00126                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPLInit detected device not configured\r\n");
00127 #endif
00128         }
00129 
00130         // Log output if device is configured
00131 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00132         if (xPLConfiguerd) putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPLInit detected the device is configured\r\n");
00133 #endif
00134 
00135         // Kick the heart beat timer off
00136         xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount = TickGet() + (xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval*(TICK_SECOND*60));
00137 
00138         // Return with sucess
00139 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00140         putrsUART((ROM char*)"All init processes completed, ready to go \r\n");
00141 #endif
00142 
00143         return 1;
00144 
00145 }//end UserInit

00147 
00148 //*********************************************************************
00149 /* Loads data from EE Prom into the selected config pointer.
00150 
00151 @result Returns False is first character is not correct, used to ensure data is valid
00152 @param  *p, pointer to config dat
00153 @param  Start_Address,  EEProm position to start loading from
00154 @param  Data_Size, the size in bytes of the configuration data
00155  */
00156 
00157 BOOL xPLLoadEEConfig(void *p, int Start_Address, int Data_Size) {
00158 
00159     BYTE c;
00160     BYTE *dest=(BYTE *)p;
00161 
00162     XEEBeginRead(Start_Address);
00163     c = XEERead();
00164     XEEEndRead();
00165     if(c == XPLEECONFIGVERSION)     // When a record is saved, first byte is written to indicate a valid record was saved.
00166     {
00167         // We have valid config data to load
00168         XEEBeginRead(Start_Address + 1);
00169         for ( c = 0; c < (unsigned int) Data_Size; c++ )
00170             *dest++ = XEERead();
00171         XEEEndRead();
00172         return TRUE;
00173     }
00174     else
00175     {
00176                 // There is no config data to load
00177 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00178                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"The config version did not return correctly. Load failed\r\n");
00179 #endif
00180 
00181                 return FALSE;
00182         }
00183 
00184 }
00185 
00186 //*********************************************************************
00187 /* Accepts configuration data (in the form of a pointer) and saves it to EE Prom
00188 
00189 @param  *p, pointer to config dat
00190 @param  Start_Address,  EEProm position to start loading from
00191 @param  Data_Size, the size in bytes of the configuration data
00192  */
00193 
00194 void  xPLSaveEEConfig(void *p, int Start_Address, int Data_Size) {
00195 
00196     BYTE c;
00197     BYTE *src=(BYTE *)p;
00198 
00199     XEEBeginWrite(Start_Address);
00200     XEEWrite(XPLEECONFIGVERSION); // When a record is saved, first byte is written to indicate a valid record was saved.
00201     XEEEndWrite();
00202         while(XEEIsBusy());
00203 
00204         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Saving starting");
00205 
00206     for(iCount = 1; iCount < Data_Size; iCount++) {
00207                 XEEBeginWrite(Start_Address + iCount);
00208                 XEEWrite(*src++);
00209                 while(XEEIsBusy());
00210                 XEEEndWrite();
00211                 while(XEEIsBusy());
00212         }// iCount
00213 
00214         putrsUART((ROM char*)"end\r\n");
00215 }

00219 //*********************************************************************
00220 /*
00221 This task manages everything to do with the heart beat message as well as the config heart beat message
00222 
00223 */
00224 void XPLHeartBeatTiming(void) {
00225         if (TickGet() > xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount) {
00226                 if(!xPLConfiguerd) {
00227                         if(xPLNotConfiguredTimer > TickGet()) {
00228                                 // Not configured
00229                                 xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval = XPL_NOTCONFIGUREDHBINTERVAL; // added to change interval if a hub appears after timer expires
00230                         }
00231                         else if (xPLNotConfiguredTimer < TickGet()) {
00232                                 // Not configured and no hub time out has been reached
00233                                 xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval = XPL_NOTCONFIGUREDNOHUBHBINTERVAL;
00234                         }
00235                 } ///xPLConfiguerd
00236 
00237                 xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount = TickGet() + (xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval*(TICK_SECOND*60));
00238                 // Send HB message
00239                 XPLSendHeartBeat();
00240 
00241         } //<= TickGet() > xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount
00242 }// void XPLHeartBeatTiming
00243 
00244 //*********************************************************************
00245 /*
00246 This is the main task manager where everything xPL related begins.
00247 
00248 From main.c you call the StackTask(); and maybe StackApplications(); if you are in the mood for running other services that are a part of
00249 the Microchip stack. Next this function is called to perform all the xPL stuff.
00250 
00251 main.c
00252 void main(void) {
00253         while(1) {
00254                 StackTask();
00255                 StackApplications();
00256                 XPLTasks();
00257         }
00258 }
00259 
00260 
00261 SchemaTasks() is called to perform anything functions that the device being implemented needs to perform.
00262 */
00263 void XPLTasks(void) {
00264 
00265         /* There are 3 tasks here that need to run in this order
00266          1 SchemaTasks
00267          2 UDP input buffer
00268          3 xPL heart beat message
00269          Only one can run per task run! Remember the StackTask() needs to be called to flush the transmit buffer
00270 
00271         */
00272 
00273         if(UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
00274                 if (SchemaTasks()) {  // True if no task has ran
00275                         // Process heart beat
00276                         if(UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket))
00277                                 XPLHeartBeatTiming();
00278                         // Process email messages
00279                         if(UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket))
00280                                 SMTPTaskProcess();
00281                 }
00282         }
00283 
00284         // Is data waiting for us to read?
00285         if (UDPIsGetReady(XPLSocket)) {
00286 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00287                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n######################\r\nUDP xPL socket contains data\r\n");
00288 #endif
00289                 XPLProcessUDPMsg();
00290         }
00291 
00292 } // XPLTasks
00293 
00294 
00295 //*********************************************************************
00296 /*
00297 Constructs the heart beat and config hbeat messages. This is called when a message needs to be sent
00298 
00299 */
00300 void XPLSendHeartBeat(void) {
00301 
00302         memset(xPLMsgKey, '\0',xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00303 
00304         //Check if we have a MAC transmit port, if not then shit yourself
00305         if (!UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)) {
00306 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00307                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"#ERROR# XPLSendHeartBeat, no MAC transmit port\r\n");
00308 #endif
00309         }
00310         else {
00311 
00312                 // Send generic header config.basic
00313                 if(!xPLConfiguerd)
00314                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_Config,Type_Basic);
00315 
00316                 //Send generic header hbeat.basic
00317                 if(xPLConfiguerd)
00318                         XPLSendHeader(xPL_STATUS, TRUE,Class_HBeat,Type_Basic);
00319 
00320 
00321                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "interval=");
00322 
00323                 uitoa((WORD)xPLConfig.xPL_Heartbeat_Interval, xPLMsgKey);
00324                 for (iCount = 0; ! xPLMsgKey[iCount] == '\0'; iCount++) {
00325                         UDPPut(xPLMsgKey[iCount]);
00326                 }
00327 
00328                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n}\n");
00329                 // Now transmit it.
00330                 UDPFlush();
00331 
00332         } ///UDPIsPutReady(XPLSocket)
00333 }
00334 
00335 //*********************************************************************
00336 /**
00337 Used to create any xPL message. Populates the header then adds class type and opens the body.
00338 have a look at XPLSendHeartBeat(); to see it in use. Remember the body of the meesage need to be closed with the following:
00339 
00340 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n}\n");
00341 
00342 @param xPL_MessageTypes xPL_MSG_Type
00343 @param BOOL isBroadCast, if the message is not a broadcast then the target address will be taken from xPLReceivedMessage
00344 @param xPL_SchemaClasss SchemaClass
00345 @param xPL_SchemaTypess SchemaType
00346 
00347  */
00348 
00349 void XPLSendHeader(xPL_MessageTypes xPL_MSG_Type, BOOL isBroadCast, xPL_SchemaClasss SchemaClass, xPL_SchemaTypess SchemaType) {
00350 
00351         // Clear out the NODE_INFO, when a packet is received the socket is changed to point to the remote node
00352         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.IPAddr.Val =  0xffffffff;
00353 
00354         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[0]   = 0xff;
00355         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[1]   = 0xff;
00356         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[2]   = 0xff;
00357         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[3]   = 0xff;
00358         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[4]   = 0xff;
00359         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remoteNode.MACAddr.v[5]   = 0xff;
00360 
00361         UDPSocketInfo[XPLSocket].remotePort = XPL_UDP_PORT;
00362 
00363         // Send XPL message type from array
00364         UDPPutROMArray(xPLmessageTypeText[xPL_MSG_Type],8);
00365 
00366         // open the header
00367         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n{\nhop=1\nsource=");
00368         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) xPL_My_Vendor_ID);
00369         UDPPut('-');
00370         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) xPL_My_Device_ID);
00371         UDPPut('.');
00372 
00373         UDPPutArray(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID, strlen(xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID));
00374 
00375         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\ntarget=");
00376         if (isBroadCast)
00377                 UDPPut('*');
00378         else
00379         {
00380                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) xPLReceivedMessage.SourceVendor);
00381                 UDPPut('-');
00382                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) xPLReceivedMessage.SourceDeviceID);
00383                 UDPPut('.');
00384                 UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) xPLReceivedMessage.SourceInstanceID);
00385         }
00386         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n}\n");
00387 
00388         for (iCount = 0; ! xPLschemaClassText[SchemaClass][iCount] == '\0'; iCount++) {
00389                 UDPPut( xPLschemaClassText[SchemaClass][iCount]);
00390         }
00391 
00392 
00393 
00394         //UDPPutROMArray(xPLschemaClassText[SchemaClass],8);
00395         UDPPut('.');
00396         for (iCount = 0; ! xPLschemaTypeText[SchemaType][iCount] == '\0'; iCount++) {
00397                 UDPPut( xPLschemaTypeText[SchemaType][iCount]);
00398         }
00399 
00400         //UDPPutROMArray(xPLschemaTypeText[SchemaType],8);
00401         UDPPutROMString((ROM BYTE*) "\n{\n");
00402 }
00403 
00404 
00405 //*********************************************************************
00406 /**
00407 Processes a received xPL message and determines what to do with it.
00408 
00409 If the message was not handled here (if config or HBeat related) the message will be passed
00410 to SchemaProcessUDPMsg() if is directed to this device, or is a broadcast.
00411 
00412 SchemaProcessUDPMsg() is where the implemented device process received messages.
00413 */
00414 
00415 void XPLProcessUDPMsg(void) {
00416         BOOL SchemaToProcessMSG = TRUE;
00417         int intRandomNumber;
00418 
00419 
00420         if (XPLProcessUDPMsgHeader() == TRUE) {
00421                 if (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination == To_Other)
00422                         SchemaToProcessMSG = FALSE;
00423 
00424                 // If a xPL message has been received keep the not configured timer from expiring
00425                 if (!xPLConfiguerd)
00426                         xPLNotConfiguredTimer = TickGet() + (XPL_NOTCONFIGUREDTIMEOUT*TICK_SECOND);
00427 
00428 
00429 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00430                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message type: ");
00431                 putcUART('0'+ xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MessageType);
00432                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Schema Class: ");
00433                 putcUART('0'+ xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass);
00434                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Schema Type: ");
00435                 putcUART('0'+ xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes);
00436                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Destination: ");
00437                 putcUART('0'+ xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination);
00438                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00439 #endif
00440 
00441                 // Heat Beat request
00442                 if ((xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MessageType == xPL_COMMAND) && (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination == To_All )) {
00443                         //
00444 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00445                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Heart beat request,");
00446 #endif
00447                         if ((xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass == Class_HBeat) && (xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes == Type_Request)) {
00448                                 // Device discovery request
00449                                 SchemaToProcessMSG = FALSE;
00450                                 if((xPLProcessMsgCompair ((rom char *)"command", 8, '=')) && (xPLProcessMsgCompair ((rom char *)"request", 8, '\n'))) {
00451                                         //generate a random number between 2-6 seconds, and produces bheat within that time.
00452                                         intRandomNumber = (rand() / 6553) + 2;
00453 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00454                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" HBeat sent in ");
00455                                         putcUART('0'+ intRandomNumber);
00456                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" seconds \r\n");
00457 #endif
00458                                         xPLHeartbeatIntervalCount = intRandomNumber*(TICK_SECOND);
00459                                 } // command request
00460                         } // hbeat request
00461 
00462                 } // xPL_COMMAND & To_All
00463 
00464                 if (SchemaToProcessMSG) {
00465                         //
00466 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00467                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Message going to Schema to process \r\n");
00468 #endif
00469                         SchemaProcessUDPMsg();
00470                 }
00471 
00472                 else {
00473 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00474                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"skips schema, processing stopped\r\n");
00475 #endif
00476 
00477                 }
00478 
00479 
00480 
00481         } //XPLProcessUDPMsgHeader() = TRUE
00482 
00483 } // XPLProcessUDPMsg
00484 
00485 
00486 //*********************************************************************
00487 /**
00488 Takes the contents out of the buffer byte by byte to determine if it is a valid xPL message. Will
00489 also populate xPLReceivedMessage with details about the message.
00490 
00491 \todo refactoring this section might be a good idea one day
00492 
00493 @result BOOL, True if the message is valid
00494 */
00495 
00496 BOOL XPLProcessUDPMsgHeader(void) {
00497 
00498         char UDPchar;
00499         unsigned short int HeaderType;
00500         unsigned short int HeaderCount;
00501 
00502         memset(xPLMsgKey,  '\0', xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00503 
00504         // ## Message type, terminated by \n
00505         if (xPLProcess_MsgField( xPLmessageTypeText, 3, &HeaderType, '\n') == FALSE) {
00506 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00507                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in header type. Message rejected \r\n");
00508 #endif
00509                 return 0;
00510         }
00511         xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MessageType = HeaderType;
00512 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00513         putrsUART((ROM char*)"Header message type is ");
00514         uitoa((WORD)xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MessageType, (BYTE*)UDPchar);
00515         putsUART ((BYTE*)UDPchar);
00516         putrsUART((ROM char*) xPLmessageTypeText[HeaderType]);
00517         putrsUART((ROM char*) "\r\n");
00518 #endif
00519 
00520 
00521         // ## Next 2 characters should always be {\n
00522         if ((xPLProcessMsgChar('{') == FALSE) || (xPLProcessMsgChar('\n') == FALSE)) {
00523 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00524                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Missing new line character. Message rejected \r\n");
00525 #endif
00526                 return 0;
00527         }
00528 
00529         // ## Cycle though the 3 header Fields, they can be out of order.
00530         for (HeaderCount = 0; HeaderCount <= (unsigned int)3; HeaderCount++)
00531         {
00532                 // Collect the header Field and determine what type it is (HeaderType)
00533                 if (xPLProcess_MsgField(xPLHeaderKeyText, 4, &HeaderType, '=') == FALSE) {
00534 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00535                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Unknown header feild. Message rejected \r\n");
00536 #endif
00537                         return 0; // no match found
00538                 }
00539                 //====Begin HOP ====
00540                 if (HeaderType == (unsigned int) 0) {
00541                         if (xPLProcessSaveValue('\n', xPLMsgKey, 2)) //  max Field size is one, set 2 just in case
00542                         { }
00543                 }//HeaderType == 0 = HOP
00544 
00545                 //====Begin Source ====
00546                 else if (HeaderType == (unsigned int)1) {
00547 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00548                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Begin decoding the Source \r\n");
00549 #endif
00550 
00551                         memset(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceVendor,  '\0', 8);
00552                         memset(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceDeviceID, '\0', 8);
00553                         memset(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceInstanceID, '\0', 16);
00554 
00555                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('-', xPLReceivedMessage.SourceVendor, 9) == FALSE) {
00556 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00557                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Source, Vendor. Message rejected \r\n");
00558 #endif
00559                                 return 0; // empty Field
00560                         }
00561 
00562 
00563                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('.', xPLReceivedMessage.SourceDeviceID, 9) == FALSE) {
00564 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00565                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Source, Device. Message rejected \r\n");
00566 #endif
00567                                 return 0; // empty Field
00568                         }
00569 
00570                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('\n', xPLReceivedMessage.SourceInstanceID, 17) == FALSE) {
00571 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00572                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Source, Instance. Message rejected \r\n");
00573 #endif
00574                                 return 0; // empty Field
00575                         }
00576 
00577 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00578                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message Source - Vendor:");
00579                         putsUART(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceVendor);
00580                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Device:");
00581                         putsUART(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceDeviceID);
00582                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Instance:");
00583                         putsUART(xPLReceivedMessage.SourceInstanceID);
00584                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00585 #endif
00586 
00587 
00588                 }//HeaderType == 1 = SOURCE
00589 
00590 
00591                 //====Begin Target====
00592                 else if (HeaderType == (unsigned int)2) {
00593                         //
00594 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00595                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Begin decoding the Target \r\n");
00596 #endif
00597 
00598                         memset(xPLMsgKey,  '\0', xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00599                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('-', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) {
00600                                 if (stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, (ROM BYTE *)"*") == 0) {
00601                                         // The message is a broadcast
00602                                         xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination = To_All;
00603 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00604                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Broadcasted message, value: ");
00605                                         putcUART('0' + xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination );
00606                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00607 #endif
00608                                 } // broadcast message
00609                                 else {
00610                                         // Message is just an error
00611 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00612                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Target. Message rejected \r\n");
00613 #endif
00614                                         return 0; // empty Field
00615                                 } // error in message
00616                         } // xPLProcessSaveValue
00617 
00618 
00619                         else if(stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, xPL_My_Vendor_ID) == 0 ) {
00620                                 memset(xPLMsgKey,  '\0', xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00621                                 if(xPLProcessSaveValue('.', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) {
00622                                         // There is an error in the target message
00623 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00624                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Target Vendor. Message rejected \r\n");
00625 #endif
00626 
00627                                         return 0; // empty Field
00628                                 }//xPLProcessSaveValue
00629 
00630                                 if(stricmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, xPL_My_Device_ID) == 0 ) {
00631                                         memset(xPLMsgKey,  '\0', xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00632                                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('\n', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) { // will this error if device ID length = 16?
00633 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00634                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Error in Target, Device. Message rejected \r\n");
00635 #endif
00636                                                 return 0; // empty Field
00637                                         }
00638 
00639 
00640                                         if(strcmp(xPLMsgKey, xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID) == 0 ) {
00641                                                 xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination = To_Me;
00642 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00643                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message directed to me ");
00644 #endif
00645                                         }
00646                                         else {
00647                                                 xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination = To_Other;
00648 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00649                                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message to Other ");
00650 #endif
00651                                         } //xPLConfig.xPL_My_Instance_ID
00652                                 }
00653                                 else {
00654                                         xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_MsgDestination = To_Other;
00655                                         if(xPLProcessSaveValue('\n', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) { // will this error if device ID length = 16?
00656                                         }
00657 
00658 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00659                                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message to Other ");
00660 #endif
00661                                 } // xPL_My_Device_ID
00662 
00663                         } // else if(strcmppgm2ram(xPLMsgKey, xPL_My_Vendor_ID) == 0 )
00664                         else {
00665 
00666                                 if(xPLProcessSaveValue('.', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) {}
00667                                 if(xPLProcessSaveValue('\n', xPLMsgKey, 16) == FALSE) {
00668                                         // will this error if device ID length = 16
00669                                 }
00670 
00671 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00672                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message to Other \r\n");
00673 #endif
00674                         } // xPL_My_Vendor_ID
00675 
00676                 } //HeaderType = 2 = TARGET
00677 
00678 
00679                 //====Begin End of body ====
00680 
00681                 else if (HeaderType == (unsigned int)3) break;
00682 
00683                 else {
00684                         // Something went wrong with the HeaderType as this should not happen
00685 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00686                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n #ERROR# Error in HeaderType section of XPLProcessUDPMsgHeader\r\n");
00687                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Header type: ");
00688                         putcUART('0'+ HeaderType);
00689                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" \r\n");
00690 
00691 #endif
00692                         return 0;
00693                 }
00694 
00695         } //for
00696 
00697 
00698 
00699         // Collect the class
00700 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00701         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Begin decoding the Schema Class \r\n");
00702 #endif
00703 
00704         if (xPLProcess_MsgField(xPLschemaClassText, XPL_SCHEMACLASS_SIZE, (unsigned short int *) xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaClass ,'.') == FALSE) {
00705 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00706                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" error is schema class. Message rejected.\r\n");
00707 #endif
00708                 return 0; // no match found
00709         }
00710 
00711         // Collect the type
00712 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00713         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Begin decoding the Schema Type \r\n");
00714 #endif
00715 
00716         if (xPLProcess_MsgField(xPLschemaTypeText, XPL_SCHEMATYPE_SIZE, (unsigned short int *)xPLReceivedMessage.xPL_SchemaTypes, '\n') == FALSE) {
00717 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00718                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" error is schema type. Message rejected.\r\n");
00719 #endif
00720                 return 0; // no match found
00721         }
00722 
00723 
00724         // Next 2 characters should always be {\n
00725 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00726         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Open the body of the message { NewLine \r\n");
00727 #endif
00728         if ((xPLProcessMsgChar('{') == FALSE) || (xPLProcessMsgChar('\n') == FALSE)) {
00729                 //
00730 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00731                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" expected end of header. Message rejected.\r\n");
00732 #endif
00733                 return 0; // no match found
00734         }
00735 
00736 
00737 
00738         // We made it :) The packet seems valid
00739 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00740         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Message accepted.\r\n");
00741 #endif
00742         return TRUE;
00743 
00744 } //XPLProcessUDPMsgHeader
00745 
00746 //*********************************************************************
00747 /**
00748 Extracts data out of the buffer and populates the result into the pointer can converts to lower case. If the
00749 terminator character does not appear before the maximum size is reached then the result will be fales (fail)
00750 
00751 @param char TermChar, character that will terminate data collection
00752 @param char *Result, pointer where the data will come from
00753 @param  MaxSize, maximum size of the data
00754 @result BOOL, was the value correctly saved
00755 */
00756 
00757 BOOL xPLProcessSaveValue(char TermChar, char *Result, int MaxSize) {
00758 
00759         char NextChar;
00760         int CountBufferChars;
00761 
00762         for(CountBufferChars = 0; CountBufferChars <= MaxSize; CountBufferChars++) {
00763                 UDPGet(&NextChar);
00764                 if(NextChar >= 'A' && NextChar <= 'Z')
00765                         NextChar -= 'A' - 'a'; //Convert to lower case
00766                 if((NextChar == TermChar) || (NextChar == '\n')) {
00767 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00768                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPLProcessSaveValue: ");
00769                         putsUART(Result);
00770                         if((NextChar == TermChar) && (NextChar != '\n')) {
00771                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Correctly ended by term char:");
00772                                 putcUART((BYTE)NextChar);
00773                                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" \r\n");
00774                         }
00775                         if(NextChar == '\n') putrsUART((ROM char*)" Ended by New Line\r\n");
00776 #endif
00777 
00778                         if(NextChar == TermChar) return TRUE; // term character found but we have data
00779                         return FALSE;
00780                 } // term chars
00781 
00782                 Result[CountBufferChars] = NextChar;
00783 
00784         } // for
00785 
00786 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00787         putrsUART((ROM char*)"xPLProcessSaveValue: ");
00788         putsUART(Result);
00789         putrsUART((ROM char*)" ended by max size\r\n");
00790 #endif
00791         return TRUE; // reached the max number of characters
00792 } //xPLProcessSaveValue
00793 
00794 
00795 //*********************************************************************
00796 /**
00797 Check one character from the input source
00798 
00799 @param char Expected, the char that is expected to be in the buffer
00800 @result BOOL, True if the value are the same
00801 */
00802 BOOL xPLProcessMsgChar(char Expected) {
00803 
00804         char NextChar;
00805         UDPGet(&NextChar);
00806         if(NextChar >= 'A' && NextChar <= 'Z')
00807                 NextChar -= 'A' - 'a';  //Convert to lower case
00808         if (NextChar == Expected)
00809                 return TRUE;
00810         return FALSE;
00811 
00812 }
00813 
00814 
00815 //*********************************************************************
00816 /**
00817 
00818 Takes a data from the buffer and determines if it matches a value in the supplied ROM array.
00819 If the terminator character does not appear before the maximum size is reached then the result will be fales (fail)
00820 
00821 @param rom char **ValidOptions, looks for a match with on of the values stored in this array
00822 @param  ArraySize, maximum size of the expected value
00823 @param unsigned short int *Result, The position in the array where the match was found
00824 @param char TermChar, terminator character
00825 @result BOOL, true if processed as expected and match was found
00826 
00827 */
00828 
00829 BOOL xPLProcess_MsgField(rom char **ValidOptions, int ArraySize, unsigned short int *Result, char TermChar) {
00830 
00831         char NextChar;
00832         int CountBufferChars =0;
00833 
00834         // Collect characters until terminator is found or max size is reached.
00835         UDPGet(&NextChar);
00836         while ((NextChar != TermChar) && (NextChar != '\n' ) && ( CountBufferChars < 127) ) {
00837                 if(NextChar >= 'A' && NextChar <= 'Z')
00838                         NextChar -= 'A' - 'a';
00839                 //tolower(NextChar); // Convert to lower case
00840                 xPLMsgValue[CountBufferChars] = NextChar;
00841                 CountBufferChars++;
00842                 UDPGet(&NextChar);
00843         }
00844         xPLMsgValue[CountBufferChars] = '\0';
00845 
00846         // cycle thought the array to see if there is a match
00847         for(iCount=0; iCount < ArraySize; iCount++) {
00848                 if (strncmppgm2ram(xPLMsgValue, ValidOptions[iCount], CountBufferChars) ==0) { // a match was found
00849                         *Result = iCount;
00850 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00851                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" - xPLProcess_MsgField, int match: ");
00852                         putcUART('0'+ iCount);
00853                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" With Result:");
00854                         putrsUART((ROM char*) ValidOptions[iCount]);
00855                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00856 #endif
00857                         return TRUE;
00858                 }
00859 
00860         }
00861 
00862         // no match was found
00863 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00864         putrsUART((ROM char*)" - xPLProcess_MsgField,No match found with string:");
00865         putsUART(xPLMsgValue);
00866         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00867 #endif
00868 
00869         return 0;
00870 
00871 }
00872 
00873 //*********************************************************************
00874 /**
00875 
00876 Compairs data in the input buffer to a string to see if they are a match.
00877 
00878 @param rom char *ValidResult,  string we are looking for
00879 @param  MaxSize, max chars to process,
00880 @param char TermChar, character that terminates matching
00881 @result BOOL, was correct data received
00882 */
00883 
00884 BOOL xPLProcessMsgCompair (rom char *ValidResult, int MaxSize, char TermChar) {
00885         char NextChar;
00886 
00887         // Collect characters until terminator is found or max size is reached.
00888         UDPGet(&NextChar);
00889         while ((NextChar != TermChar) && (NextChar != '\n' ) && ( iCount < MaxSize) ) {
00890                 if(NextChar >= 'A' && NextChar <= 'Z')
00891                         NextChar -= 'A' - 'a';  //Convert to lower case
00892                 if(!(NextChar==ValidResult[iCount])) {
00893 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00894                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" - xPLProcessMsgCompair, No Match. iCount:");
00895                         putcUART('0'+ iCount);
00896                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" Compaired to:");
00897                         putcUART((char)ValidResult);
00898                         putrsUART((ROM char*)" no match on char:");
00899                         putcUART((char)NextChar);
00900                         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00901 #endif
00902                         return FALSE;
00903                 }
00904 
00905                 iCount++;
00906                 UDPGet(&NextChar);
00907         }
00908 
00909         if      (iCount == 1) {
00910 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00911                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" - xPLProcessMsgCompair, No Match. iCount:");
00912                 putcUART('0'+ iCount);
00913                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" Compaired to:");
00914                 putrsUART(ValidResult);
00915                 putrsUART((ROM char*)" no match as it was to short");
00916                 putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
00917 #endif
00918 
00919                 return FALSE; // First char was a terminator
00920         }
00921 
00922         return TRUE;
00923 }
00924 
00925 //*********************************************************************
00926 /**
00927 
00928  searches though an array looking for a match to TheValue. When a match is found
00929  it will return the position in the array
00930 
00931 @param rom char **ValidOptions, array of posible matches
00932 @param  ArraySize, size of ValidOptions
00933 @param  *Result,  position in array where match was found
00934 @param char * TheValue,  text to be searched
00935 @result BOOL, true if processed as expected and match was found
00936 */
00937 
00938 BOOL xPLFindArrayInKVP(rom char **ValidOptions, int ArraySize, int *Result, char * TheValue) {
00939 
00940         int CountBufferChars;
00941 
00942         // cycle thought the array to see if there is a match
00943         for(iCount=0; iCount < ArraySize; iCount++)
00944         {
00945 
00946                 CountBufferChars = sizeof(ValidOptions[iCount]);
00947                 if (strncmppgm2ram(TheValue, ValidOptions[iCount],CountBufferChars) ==0)
00948                 { // a match was found
00949                         *Result = iCount;
00950                         return TRUE;
00951                 }
00952         }
00953 
00954         // no match was found
00955         return 0;
00956 }
00957 
00958 
00959 //*********************************************************************
00960 /**
00961 
00962  Loads a Key and a Value from the UDP message. Populates this into variables.
00963 
00964 @param char * TheKey, location to save the data for the key
00965 @param char * TheValue, location to save the data for the value
00966 @result BOOL, true if processed as expected
00967 */
00968 
00969 BOOL SaveKVP (char * TheKey, char * TheValue) {
00970 
00971         int short iCount;
00972         char NextChar;
00973 
00974         // clear out any old data
00975         memset (TheKey, '\0', xPLMSGKEYLENGTH);
00976         memset (TheValue, '\0', xPLMSGVALUELENGTH);
00977 
00978         // Load character by character
00979         for (iCount =0; iCount < xPLMSGKEYLENGTH; iCount++) {
00980                 UDPGet(&NextChar);
00981                 if(NextChar >= 'A' && NextChar <= 'Z')
00982                         NextChar -= 'A' - 'a'; //Convert to lower case for the key but we dont want to do that for the value
00983                 if (NextChar == '=') break;
00984                 if (NextChar == '}') return FALSE;
00985                 TheKey[iCount] = NextChar;
00986         } // for key
00987 
00988 
00989 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
00990         putrsUART((ROM char*)"TheKey = ");
00991         putsUART(TheKey);
00992 #endif
00993 
00994 
00995         for (iCount =0; iCount < xPLMSGVALUELENGTH; iCount++) {
00996                 UDPGet(&NextChar);
00997                 if (NextChar == '\n') break;
00998                 if (NextChar == '}') return FALSE;
00999                 TheValue[iCount] = NextChar;
01000         } // for key
01001 
01002 
01003 #if defined(DEBUG_UART)
01004         putrsUART((ROM char*)" TheValue = ");
01005         putsUART(TheValue);
01006         putrsUART((ROM char*)"\r\n");
01007 #endif
01008 
01009 
01010         return TRUE;
01011 
01012 }
